neighbors.name: John Angelotti
neighbors.claims: John Angelotti owns and resides at 5125 Viaduct Avenue in Halethorpe, having purchased the property in 2002 ([Homes.com](https://www.homes.com/property/5125-viaduct-ave-halethorpe-md/sgw7rj3bw1x2w/)). He is the President of DCG Technical Solutions, a managed IT services provider, a role he has held for over two decades ([DCG Technical Solutions](https://www.dcgla.com/malware-protection-strategies-business-endpoints/)). While his business operates significantly in California, he maintains his residence in Baltimore County ([DCG Technical Solutions](https://www.dcgla.com/exchange-backup-los-angeles/)). No record of public statements regarding renewable energy development was found.
neighbors.influence_justification: Business owner with no local political footprint

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through general community outreach. As a technology business owner, he may be receptive to technical discussions regarding project infrastructure, but no specific stance is currently known.

neighbors.name: Samantha C. Connelly
neighbors.claims: Samantha C. Connelly is associated with the residential property at 704 Woodland Drive in Halethorpe, which corresponds to the pinned parcel ([Redfin](https://www.redfin.com/MD/Halethorpe/704-Woodland-Dr-21227/home/9370286)). Public records indicate she is a resident at this location ([FreeBackgroundChecks](https://freebackgroundchecks.com/people-search/samantha-connelly/)). There are no confirmed news reports or public meeting minutes indicating a position on local development or community leadership roles for this specific individual in Baltimore County.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via standard neighbor communications. Verify ownership status during initial contact, as public datasets regarding the current deed holder are conflicting.

neighbors.name: Noah Hutton
neighbors.claims: The current resident is Noah Hutton (born c. 1991), a chemistry teacher at Edgewood High School and the head cross country coach at the Community College of Baltimore County (CCBC) Essex ([CCBC Essex](https://ccbcessexknights.com/sports/mxc/2018-19/bios/hutton_noah_pd0n)). He resides at 5123 Viaduct Avenue in Halethorpe, a fact he confirmed publicly while testifying before the Harford County Council in 2024 ([Harford County Council](https://harfordcountymd.new.swagit.com/videos/301638)). Unlike the deceased Noah Hutton mentioned in the draft (his father), this Noah Hutton is civically active, having spoken at public hearings regarding school funding and county budgets ([Harford County Council](https://harfordcountymd.new.swagit.com/videos/301638)). He is active in the Harford County Education Association union ([MSEA](https://marylandeducators.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/2024_MSEA-At-Large-Bios_Final.pdf)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Educator and active union member who testifies at hearings

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage as a community leader. Mr. Hutton is comfortable with public speaking and policy details. Focus on how the project benefits local tax revenues for services like education, given his documented advocacy for school funding.

neighbors.disambiguation: Profile updated to reflect living resident Noah Hutton (Son/Teacher), not the deceased Noah Kent Hutton Jr. (Father/Caterer).
